abstract.p: Photos of several denim outfits seen in New York City (On the Street column) (M)

block.p: The blue denim Western-style jacket has become a mass uniform for young women, replacing the tailored sports jacket, a trend shown here in the spring of 1999. Last week's fall-like weather cemented this fashion shift for the dress-down generation. The jackets have been recut by clothing manufacturers for a stylish short, snug fit. Ninety-nine percent of them are in shades of blue, with the occasional jolt of color. And one young innovator came up with a new way to stow it when the weather turned warmer: buttoning the sleeves together and wearing it like a sling bag, below left.
